attributes.action: Mandate foundational tech curriculum for kids to bridge the digital divide.
attributes.additional_details: 1 in 5 children lacks digital access at home, widening inequality. Only 15% of teachers feel confident teaching computing, leaving many students without crucial skills. With 80% of future jobs requiring digital literacy, failing to act now will harm the UK’s economy and workforce. A full tech education safeguards children from online harm, misinformation, and cyber threats. The UK government needs to mandate a minimum literacy and readiness curriculum to help kids thrive in a digital world.
attributes.background: Tech shapes our world, 40% of UK schools lack structured computing lessons. Without early exposure, children face digital exclusion, job market disadvantages & online risks.  We urge Parliament to mandate foundational tech education, ensuring children gain essential digital skills for their future.

rejection.details: Computing is already part of the National Curriculum from Key Stage 1. You can find more information here: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/national-curriculum-in-england-computing-programmes-of-study
